com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Class BaseDatasetLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayer
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseDatasetLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, DatasetLayer, Layer, Searchable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseFeatureLayer, BaseImageLayer
public abstract class BaseDatasetLayer
extends BaseLayer
implements DatasetLayer

A standard implementation of DatasetLayer. You can subclass it if you choose. Apart from the support it provides for the super-class - BaseLayer, it also provides support for MapDataset and Extent. It also manages a search by Envelope.

setMaximumScale

public void setMaximumScale(double scale)
If this BaseDatasetLayer is currently added to a Map, then the scale is expected to be map units/pixel, same as returned by Map.getScale(). However, if this BaseDatasetLayer has not yet been added to a Map, then the scale value is expected to be dataset units/pixel. In this way, a source of data that defines map scales for a particular layer, can define it relative to the underlying data source. For example, an ArcIMS service may define scale dependency based upon the authored map, instead of being relative to the end-user client's map. This becomes important when the Map is projected, and the Map unit is consequently modifed.

Specified by:
setMaximumScale in interface Layer
Overrides:
setMaximumScale in class BaseLayer
Parameters:
scale - the new maximum scale value
See Also:
Layer.setMaximumScale(double)

getMaximumScale

public double getMaximumScale()
If this BaseDatasetLayer is currently added to a Map, and if the projection of the Map is different from the projection that was current at the time that the maximum scale was set then the value returned by this method will be transformed into an appropriate value for the Map's current projection. Otherwise, the value that was set previously will be returned

Specified by:
getMaximumScale in interface Layer
Overrides:
getMaximumScale in class BaseLayer
Returns:
the maximum scale value
See Also:
Layer.getMaximumScale(), setMaximumScale(double)

fetch

public void fetch(Envelope extent,
                  double scale,
                  int width,
                  int height)
This method is constrained by CACHING and SPATIAL_QUERY Capabilities. If they are both OkToUse then this method delegates to getMapDataset.fetch(), otherwise, this method does nothing.

Specified by:
fetch in interface DatasetLayer
Parameters:
extent - the new extent of the Display
scale - the new map scale in mapunits/pixel
width - the new map size in pixels across
height - the new map size in pixels down
See Also:
MapDataset.fetch(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope, double, int, int), LayerCapabilities.SPATIAL_QUERY, Capability.isAvailable()

search

public Cursor search(QueryFilter filter)
This method is constrained by ATTRIBUTE_QUERY and SPATIAL_QUERY Capabilities. If the specified filter is a SpatialFilter and the SPATIAL_QUERY Capability is OkToUse, or if ATTRIBUTE_QUERY Capability is OkToUse, then this method delegates to getMapDataset.search(). Otherwise, this method returns an empty Cursor.

If the search method is delegated, then the filter is constrained by the CACHING Cability. If the CACHING Capability is not OkToUse, then the UseCache property of the filter will be changed == false, otherwise the UseCache property will be unchanged.

Specified by:
search in interface Searchable
Parameters:
filter - the Query that defines the search
Returns:
the corresponding Cursor
See Also:
LayerCapabilities.SPATIAL_QUERY, Capability.isAvailable()

search

public Cursor search(Envelope qe,
                     Fields qf)
Helper method, constructs a SpatialFilter for search(QueryFilter) using createSpatialSearchFilter and the given Envelope and Fields.

Specified by:
search in interface DatasetLayer
Parameters:
qe - the query envelope, which will be clipped to the layer's dataset extent
qf - the Fields to be retrieved, or null == retrieve all Fields
Returns:
the resulting Cursor, null == no data found

createSpatialSearchFilter

public BaseSpatialFilter createSpatialSearchFilter(FeatureGeometry geometry,
                                                   Fields fields)
Used by the search(Envelope,Fields) method to create the query necessary for envelope searching. The UseCache property will be set == true provided the CACHING Capability is OkToUse

Specified by:
createSpatialSearchFilter in interface DatasetLayer
Parameters:
geometry - the selection geometry
fields - the query fields, or null == get all the Fields from the Dataset (providing the Dataset is of type Table)
See Also:
DatasetLayer.search(Envelope,Fields)

createMapFilter

protected BaseMapFilter createMapFilter(DisplayArea displayArea)
Used by the drawWithinScale method to create the query necessary for map drawing. The UseCache property will be set as == true provided the CACHING Capability is OkToUse.

Parameters:
displayArea - the display area
Returns:
the query filter
See Also:
drawWithinScale(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int)

drawWithinScale

public void drawWithinScale(DisplayArea displayArea,
                            int drawPhase)
                     throws InterruptedException
If the DisplayArea intersects with this Layer's extent, and the SPATIAL_QUERY Capability is OkToUse, then this method will obtain a search filter using the createMapFilter method and then use it in conjunction with the drawFilter method. Otherwise this method will do nothing

Specified by:
drawWithinScale in interface Layer
Overrides:
drawWithinScale in class BaseLayer
Parameters:
displayArea - the portion of the display
drawPhase - one of the draw phase identifiers
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the layer drawing has been cancelled
See Also:
Layer.draw(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int)

drawFilter

protected abstract void drawFilter(BaseSpatialFilter filter,
                                   Graphics2D gctxt,
                                   int drawPhase)
                            throws InterruptedException
Sub-classes must implement this method in order to take advantage of the implementation of the BaseLayer.draw, and BaseDatasetLayer.drawWithinScale methods. A preliminary MapFilter is already created, and the Graphics2D on which to render is created by drawWithinScale. All the subclass implementation has to do is query the associated Dataset for data, then render it to the Graphics2D.

Parameters:
filter - the MapFilter with pre-built spatial relation
gctxt - the Graphics2D on which to render
drawPhase - the draw phase
InterruptedException
